tbnpy.adaptiveMH module¶

class tbnpy.adaptiveMH.AdaptConfig(burnin: int = 200, gamma: float = 0.2, target_accept: float = 0.234, min_log_sigma: float = -12.0, max_log_sigma: float = 6.0, alpha: float = 0.5)[source]¶

Bases: object

alpha: float = 0.5¶
burnin: int = 200¶
gamma: float = 0.2¶
max_log_sigma: float = 6.0¶
min_log_sigma: float = -12.0¶
target_accept: float = 0.234¶
class tbnpy.adaptiveMH.HybridAdaptiveMH(probs: Dict[str, Any], variables: Dict[str, Any] | Sequence[Any], evidence_df, n_chain: int, device: str | device = 'cpu', adapt: AdaptConfig = AdaptConfig(burnin=200, gamma=0.2, target_accept=0.234, min_log_sigma=-12.0, max_log_sigma=6.0, alpha=0.5))[source]¶

Bases: object

Tensorised Metropolis–Hastings for hybrid (discrete + continuous) BN, with many evidence rows and many chains.

  • Latent variable values are stored in state[var_name] with shape (n_evi, n_chain).

  • Evidence is stored in evidence_1d[var_name] with shape (n_evi,).

  • Each MH step updates ONE variable at a time (easy and robust). (You can extend to blocks later.)

init_state_from_forward_samples(probs_copy: Dict[str, Any])[source]¶

Initialise latent state from a forward-sampling result compatible with your sample_evidence(), i.e. each prob in probs_copy has prob.Cs of shape (n_evi, n_sample, …) and prob.ps of shape (n_evi, n_sample). We treat n_sample as n_chain here.

init_state_random(seed: int | None = None)[source]¶

Fallback initializer if you don’t want to rely on forward sampling. Discrete: uniform over categories Continuous: standard normal

mh_update_block(vars: List[Variable], iteration: int) → Tensor[source]¶

Metropolis–Hastings update for a block of variables. vars: list[Variable] Returns accept mask: (n_chain,)

run(n_iter: int, update_blocks: List[List[str]] | None = None, store_every: int = 0, progress_every: int = 100) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Run MCMC with optional block updates.

Parameters:

  • n_iter (int) – Number of MCMC iterations.

  • update_blocks (list[list[str]] or None) – Variable blocks to update together. - None → update all latent variables one by one - Each inner list is a block of variable names - Variables not listed are updated individually

  • store_every (int) – If >0, stores thinned samples every store_every iterations. Warning: storing full (n_evi, n_chain) states can be very large.

Returns:

  • ‘accept_rate’: dict[block_name -> float]

  • ’logp_chain’: final (n_chain,)

  • ’logp_evi_chain’: final (n_evi, n_chain)

  • ’states_thinned’ (optional)

  • ’log_sigma’ (continuous proposal scales)

Return type:

dict with

tbnpy.adaptiveMH.build_Cs_3d(prob, state: Dict[str, Tensor], evidence_1d: Dict[str, Tensor]) → Tensor[source]¶
Build Cs with shape (n_evi, n_chain, n_childs + n_parents) in the column order:

[child_0, …, child_{n_childs-1}, parent_0, …, parent_{n_parents-1}]

Evidence variables are broadcast to (n_evi, n_chain). Latent variables come from state[var_name] which must be (n_evi, n_chain).

Input: prob : probability object

Must have prob.childs and prob.parents lists of variable objects.

state: dict

state[“X”] has shape (n_evi, n_chain)

evidence_1d: dict

evidence_1d[“E”] has shape (n_evi,)

tbnpy.adaptiveMH.build_factors_by_var(probs: Dict[str, Any]) → Dict[str, List[Any]][source]¶

Map variable name -> list of probability objects (factors) that depend on it (as either child or parent).

tbnpy.adaptiveMH.factor_logp_2d(prob, Cs_3d: Tensor) → Tensor[source]¶

Evaluate prob.log_prob on Cs_3d (n_evi, n_chain, dim) by flattening. Returns (n_evi, n_chain).

tbnpy.adaptiveMH.is_continuous(var) → bool[source]¶
tbnpy.adaptiveMH.is_discrete(var) → bool[source]¶
tbnpy.adaptiveMH.num_categories(var) → int[source]¶
tbnpy.adaptiveMH.propose_continuous_rw_gaussian(x: Tensor, sigma: float) → Tensor[source]¶

Symmetric Gaussian random-walk proposal. x: (n_evi, n_chain) float tensor

tbnpy.adaptiveMH.propose_discrete_adaptive(x: Tensor, logits: Tensor, alpha: float) → Tensor[source]¶

Adaptive symmetric proposal for a discrete variable.

Parameters:

  • x (torch.Tensor) – Current state, shape (n_evi, n_chain), integer in [0, K-1]

  • logits (torch.Tensor) – Global adaptive logits, shape (K,)

  • alpha (float) – Mixing weight for local vs global proposal (0 < alpha < 1)

Returns:

x_new – Proposed state, same shape as x

Return type:

torch.Tensor
